channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Liam Mannix
item.description: Data from Sydney’s February outbreak shows how dry air can increase the coronavirus' ability to spread, researchers claim.
item.title: COVID-19 danger may rise in dry weather, 'provocative' study shows

item.description: The Nasdaq has surged to a new high on Wall Street as tech shares roared higher.
item.title: Tech rally elevates Nasdaq to record high

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: The discovery points the way to new methods to stop superbugs and help the 700,000 people who die from infections worldwide annually.
item.title: Researchers discover how superbugs pass on their antibiotic resistance

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: In a letter to Premier Gladys Berejiklian, the union accused the government of failing to provide and enforce legitimate regulations for commuters.
item.title: Bus drivers threaten 48-hour strike over masks, social distancing

item.description: The hottest air temperature recorded anywhere on the planet in at least a century, and possibly ever, was reached in Death Valley in California's Mojave Desert on Sunday.
item.title: New global temperature record may have been set in California's Death Valley

item.description: The hip hop artist was shot dead in his recording studio by a masked assailant in 2002, in one of New York City's most notorious unsolved killings.
item.title: Two men arrested in 2002 killing of Run-DMC's Jam Master Jay

item.description: The current levels of infection are so remarkable that they have surprised state and city officials. But leaders are consumed by the likelihood that, any day now, their numbers will begin rising.
item.title: New York has tamed the coronavirus. Can it hold off a second wave?

item.description: The country was already deep in financial crisis and was struggling with a COVID-19 spike before the August 4 blast that killed at least 178 people.
item.title: Lebanon needs two-week lockdown after 'shocking' COVID-19 rise, minister says

item.description: The decision, which overturns five decades of protections, sets the stage for what is expected to be a fierce legal battle over the fate of the vast, remote Alaska habitat.
item.title: Trump administration finalises plan to open Arctic refuge to drilling

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: Kamala Harris got tough on the web when she was a prosecutor in California, but isn't likely to rock the boat hard if the Democrats take the White House in November.
item.title: Don't hold your breath for radical reform of Big Tech under Biden-Harris

item.description: Our sense of Australia as the land of the fair go is taking another battering as we see the powerful and the well-connected operating against different rules.
item.title: Political system skewed towards protecting the powerful

item.dc:creator: Tim Soutphommasane
item.description: It has been nearly five decades since an official multiculturalism was adopted in Australia. Yet that has had limited visible impact on our media.
item.title: Elsewhere they get it but the Australian media is still living in White Australia

item.description: The forecast drop in international migration because of the pandemic will translate to reduced demand for housing, but there is a way to cushion this hit to the state's economy.
item.title: The short-term economic stimulus that will deliver long-term social dividends to NSW

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: We Australians – all – we Australians, not just Mr Hero, (sniff) – have developed a certain natural equanimity about sharks.
item.title: Women of Australia, the shark-punching hero from Port Macquarie is no big deal

item.dc:creator: Matt Wade
item.description: NSW businesses have slashed staff and investment but there are signs of some green shoots.
item.title: NSW businesses more optimistic after hitting 'rock bottom'

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: Sydneysiders with flu symptoms are more likely to have COVID-19 than influenza, NSW’s Chief Health Officer warns.
item.title: Think you have the flu? It's probably COVID-19: new data prompts symptoms warning

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: The Sharks star has been in discussions with the Titans and accepted a request from the club to help save his friend's season at the judiciary.
item.title: Johnson agrees to back Proctor's bid to beat biting charge

item.dc:creator: Megan Gorrey
item.description: Behind the bland concrete exteriors and uniform wooden front doors of Waterloo's public housing blocks live thousands of Sydneysiders, each with their own stories of struggle and triumph, strength and vulnerability.
item.title: 'Where are they going to go?': The human faces behind the Waterloo estate

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: It's the great suburban dream: the Neutral Bay Club has had a victory in its battle against a council fine.
item.title: Fine and dandy at the Neutral Bay Club

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Tuesday, August 18

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: Two dozen nurses deployed to the frontline of Melbourne's COVID-19 outbreak last month were released from quarantine on Monday with a stern warning for Queenslanders.
item.title: COVID warning from Queensland nurses deployed to Melbourne

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Four NSW councils that hold the largest amounts of money from developer levies have gaps in their governance and controls over the contributions, an Audit Office report has found.
item.title: Audit finds gaps in council controls over developer levies

item.dc:creator: Ellen Fitzgerald
item.description: Demand for “higher” pay, booming dogs, and Maltese migration
item.title: In the Herald: August 18, 1964

item.description: When the underachieving Fine Cotton won a race at Eagle Farm in Brisbane, Australian racing was rocked by one of its biggest scandals.
item.title: From the Archives, 1984: The Fine Cotton affair

item.dc:creator: Melissa Singer
item.description: Whether you're in lockdown or just a little wary about visiting the shops, consider this a refresher course.
item.title: These online shopping hacks will take the guesswork out, every time

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Tuesday, August 18

item.dc:creator: Stephen Brook
item.description: The commentator is selling up and heading for the countryside.
item.title: CBD Melbourne: Bolt does a bolt from Melbourne

item.dc:creator: Jason Steger
item.description: The former head of Melbourne's Wheeler Centre will program SWF for 2021.
item.title: Michael Williams joins Sydney Writers' Festival as interim director

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, August 18, 2020

item.dc:creator: Tammy Mills
item.description: Almost all of Victoria's second coronavirus wave can be traced to travellers quarantined at the Rydges on Swanston and Stamford Plaza, where face masks were not mandatory for guards or travellers in high-risk situations.
item.title: Two hotels source of second wave as 'inappropriate' advice to guards revealed

item.dc:creator: Sumeyya Ilanbey
item.description: The Andrews government has used $9.7 billion of the debt facility it set up in April, when the Treasurer conceded the state may need to access the entire sum.
item.title: Auditor-General to scrutinise Victoria's mammoth coronavirus borrowing

item.description: We need a Science Future Fund that will allow us to ensure long-term investment in an area of long-term strategic need.
item.title: Science and innovation must help fuel our post-COVID recovery

item.description: Jealous of your friends’ trendy DIY facemasks? It’s not too late to make your own! Benefit from the experience of someone who has recently been through the experience.
item.title: Can't sew? Never fear, here's a simple 26-step guide to stuffing up your own face masks

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: Ziggy Ramo said he was forced to abandon plans to sing a song protesting against Australia's treatment of Indigenous people with the lyrics "f-ck the Anzacs" on Q+A.
item.title: Indigenous rapper accuses the ABC of censorship

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Richmond's Tom Lynch is under the microscope for his off-the-ball whack on his Gold Coast opponent on a night Jack Riewoldt opened up about hub life.
item.title: 'Cheap shot': Tiger forward faces scrutiny for stomach punch

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: People in border towns struggling to get to medical appointments has sparked the Prime Minister to personally ask state premiers to find urgent solutions.
item.title: Morrison asks state premiers for urgent solutions to border problems

item.dc:creator: Katina Curtis
item.description: Coalition MPs want the caps on international arrivals increased, saying they are a mere fraction of the number of Australians who want to come home.
item.title: 'Not a glimmer of hope': Government MPs call for boost in overseas arrivals

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: The Tigers have regained their groove and are firmly in the hunt for a top-four berth after toppling the Gold Coast Suns on Monday night.
item.title: Sunny days: Tigers continue push for top four by eclipsing Suns

item.description: And what not to wear in New Orleans.
item.title: Veronica Mars hits Port Macquarie

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: Workers who don't get pay rises over the next five years can blame a lift in the superannuation guarantee, Assistant Minister for Superannuation Jane Hume has warned.
item.title: 'There is a trade-off' between wage growth and higher super guarantee: Hume

item.description: The man, who was on a 14-day quarantine order after returning from Sydney, used a ladder on four occasions to climb out of his hotel room, police claim.
item.title: Perth man accused of breaching quarantine by climbing out of hotel to visit girlfriend

item.dc:creator: Anthony Colangelo
item.description: The AFL says Michael Gibbons, not Jack Newnes, should have taken the late free kick that saw Carlton claim a miraculous victory over Fremantle.
item.title: Gibbons, not Newnes, should have taken after-the-siren shot: AFL

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: Victoria reported 279 new coronavirus cases on Sunday, as its state of emergency was extended.
item.title: As the day unfolded: Victoria records 282 new COVID-19 cases as state of emergency extended; Gladys Berejiklian apologises for Ruby Princess errors as Australian death toll jumps to 421

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: The Victorian government will boost efforts to keep family violence offenders away from their victims, as demand for perpetrator services soars during the COVID-19 crisis.
item.title: State puts $20m into family violence programs

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Another outbreak such as the one at Hambleton House in Albert Park is inevitable without intervention, disability advocates say.
item.title: COVID-19 crisis looming in disability services, advocates warn

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: Twenty years on from the waterfront dispute, two players from opposite sides still have no time for the other's view on how to make the country work better.
item.title: Grow the cake: another Waterfront dispute not the way forward, says Corrigan

item.dc:creator: Clay Lucas
item.description: Legal action over aged care deaths has begun, with a Supreme Court writ filed against Epping Gardens, where more than 200 COVID-19 infections have occurred.
item.title: First legal action launched against owners of Epping Gardens aged care

item.dc:creator: Aisha Dow
item.description: Infectious disease experts have warned Victoria to brace for more harrowing daily death tolls after 25 lives were reported lost to the virus on Monday.
item.title: More heartbreaking days ahead as Victoria's COVID-19 death rate triples

item.dc:creator: Simone Fox Koob
item.description: When a judge ruled on Monday that the killer of Maxie Antoniou's daughter was not guilty due to mental impairment, it felt like a punch in the guts.
item.title: 'She died because of her kindness': A mother's life sentence
